abstract.p: Empire State Development Corp approves proposal for new trading complex for New York Stock Exchange in lower Manhattan (S)

block.p: The Empire State Development Corporation approved a proposal for a new trading complex for the New York Stock Exchange in lower Manhattan yesterday, the first step in a public review of the project.
The Empire State Development Corporation approved a proposal for a new trading complex for the New York Stock Exchange in lower Manhattan yesterday, the first step in a public review of the project.

The proposed 50-story tower would rise across the street from the historic home of the New York Stock Exchange, on a block bounded by Exchange Place and Wall, Broad and William Streets. The $480 million, 800,000-square-foot trading complex would be built with public money below a 1.2 million-square-foot office tower.
